subject: RE: [junit] bat script ends after first ant command
msgSnippet: Hey guys, appreciate your responses. Michael s solution is a good one. I forgot to mention that my targets are defined in separate ant files, so I can t run at

Hey guys,
 appreciate your responses.

Michael's solution is a good one.
I forgot to mention that my targets are defined in separate ant files, so I
can't run at the same time. 
  Secondly, I want to run the targets ant files sequentially as well, not at
the same time.

thanks
-alok

-----Original Message-----
From: Shane Duan [mailto:sduan@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 01, 2003 3:02 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] bat script ends after first ant command


You can also run three targets at the same time by the following command
ant testClient testJsp testServlet

Alok Daipuria wrote:

>Hello everyone,
>  I was running multiple ant commands from a batch file and found that the
>bat script doesn't go past the first ant command.
> Say your batch file has commands :
>    	ant testClient
>	ant testJsp
>	ant testServlet
>  The bat file will execute only the first one - "ant testClient"
>
>  As an alternate, I have to run using the Java command line, which is not
>very neat.
>Just want to know if anyone faced the problem.
>
>thanks
>-alok
